bibl.title: William Clark, Michael, and Anson v. Henry Mitchell, Henry Russell and Elijah Mitchell. Request for Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: To the Honorable William C Carr Judge of the circuit court of St Louis county

Your petitioners Anson and Michael persons of color by their next friend William Clark assert that their mother Matilda was is a free woman so adjudged by the courts of Missouri under the territorial govern ment that about 13 years since after her right to freedom was established she went to in the state of Illinois that your petitioners were born after the said Matilda became free and have to such from their birth in the state of Illinois with their mother will this day free and at liberty will this day when they were claimed as slaves by one Elijah Mitchel and others and forcibly per the said state of Illinois and brough t to the county of St Louis where they are now detained as slaves by then S Elijah Mitchel Mitchel and Russel
who are about to remove them by force beyond the jurisdiction of this court and state. Your petitioners pray that they may be authorized to sue to establish their right to freedom and that your honor may open a writ of habeas corpus to at their having from the said jurisdictioin and they will very pray .
Anson & Michael by William Clark next friend
